components.description: A drum shown with drumsticks. A percussion instrument which is likely to be displayed as a snare drum.
components.title: Drum with Drumsticks

description: A drum shown with drumsticks. A percussion instrument which is likely to be displayed as a snare drum.
title: Drum with Drumsticks

version.description:
The Unicode Consortium accepted the following emoji 72 emojis for Unicode 9.0. This update was released on June 21, 2016. Most vendors added support for this update within the 2016 calendar year. Sample images and more about Unicode 9.0.

Emoji 4.0 was published in late 2016, which added additional emoji professions.

New in Unicode 9

emoji_net_data.category: Supplemental Symbols And Pictographs -> Miscellaneous mark
emoji_net_data.definition: A drum shown with drumsticks. A percussion instrument which is likely to be displayed as a snare drum. Drum was approved as part of Unicode  http://emojipedia.org/drum-with-drumsticks/
emoji_net_data.name: drum

bn:00056443n: Someone who is passionate about music.
Music is an art form whose medium is sound.
Music is an art form that involves sounds and silence.
A sound, or the study of such sounds, organized in time.
The artistic organization of sounds or tones that expresses ideas and emotions through the elements of rhythm, melody, harmony and tonal color.
An app that facilitates the playing of music.
Sound, organized in time in a melodious way.
An artistic form of auditory communication incorporating instrumental or vocal tones in a structured and continuous manner
The title of the hub for music and video.

bn:00028891n: A musical percussion instrument; usually consists of a hollow cylinder with a membrane stretched across each end
A percussion instrument consisting of at least one membrane that is stretched over a shell and struck directly with the player's hands or with a drumstick.
A membranophone is any musical instrument which produces sound primarily by way of a vibrating stretched membrane.
The drum is a member of the percussion group of musical instruments.
A musical instrument that uses this principle, including most drums
The stretched membrane of a drum; a percussion instrument consisting of a hollow cylinder with such a membrane at each end
Any musical instrument that produces sound via the vibration of a stretched membrane.
